reviews.text: Stayed here for a hen weekend, all 19 of us.With the number I thought it may be under average but I was wrong! This was clean, quite (even with us staying there!), cleaners every day, small pool but nice and clean.Breakfast food was ok.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location was excellent, 2 mins walk to the beach and Marbella srip and 2 mins walk the other way to the main road of shops.This is where you can catch the number 6 bus for about 1 euro which takes you straight to Puerto Banus.I would def stay here again!

reviews.title: WE CHECKED OUT!

reviews.text: Our room overlooked downtown "Beruit" also. I am hysterical at the other reviewer who said the same thing we kept saying. There were no LOCKS on the inside of your hotel room door and the lock on our balcony did not work either. Very Noisy you could hear everything going on in the hallways. Only air conditioner in bedroom...living area was warm and at night the lights in the hallway are on timers...dark hallways and then they would turn on. We ended up spending more $$$ but having a nice time at the Hotel Miramar Spa. This hotel is good for BIG groups..bachelor party weekends etc. The pool was kiddie size in the back. Spend the extra $$$ and go somewhere else!!!!!
reviews.title: Loved the El Faro!

reviews.text: Myself and 9 friends stayed at the El Faro last week for 4 nights. It was absolutely brilliant. The rooms were a decent size, very clean, and the kitchenette (with a hob and fridge) were very useful. The staff are friendly, helpful and courteous. The beds are comfortable and the bathroom is clean. The maids clean every day and change your towels. The only thing I would say they could improve (but it really isnt a big problem) is the free brekkie - it wasnt that great but they did provide croissants, cereal (a continental brekkie).
reviews.title: El Faro
el faro fab
reviews.text: The pool isnt huge, but this doesnt matter because the beach is literally a stone's throw away. There are 2 supermarkets close by (tip: buy your alcohol before you go out, Puerto Banus is so expensive!)
We have just returned from a 3 night break at El Faro.
reviews.title: Old but clean

likes.disliked: — Breakfast not worth it - reduce the room rate instead.

reviews.text: We stayed at El Faro whilst in Marbella as a friend had an apartment just up the road which couldnt sleep all of us. It is i the heart of the old town of Marbella which is quieter and cheper than Puerto Banus. It was reasonably priced, clean - with air con, good shower and facilities and only 2 mins from the beach. Puerto Banus is only 5 mins in a cab too so perfect for those wanting to visit the marina, nice restaurants, Ocean Club Beach and experience the night life without staying (and paying to be) right in the centre of it all. a good find.. which was in fact recommended by the people who have an apartment nearby.
reviews.title: Cheap but hotel in Marbella

likes.liked: — It was in a quieter part of Marbella but only 5 mins from Puerto Banus

reviews.title: Very enjoyable stay at El Faro
reviews.text: Superb location close to beach, old quarter and good restaurants. Rooms very comfortable and clean. We were on top floor on road side, with views of both mountains and beach, so we were extremely happy. Small amount of road noise which wasn't an issue at all, unless you are a very light sleeper
